verbs.description: at former beech nut site asbestos study possible reuse [V: planned] [ARG1: canajoharie] a long island - based engineering firm will study remaining asbestos pollution at the former beech nut plant and recommend how much if any of the building might be saved from demolition montgomery county officials hired the liro group under a 475 000 contract to examine partially - demolished 29-acre site that includes the former baby food factory to determine how much can be saved and how much can not the century - old property is visible from exit 29 of the state thruway and dominates the small village of canajoharie where officials have been dealing with a polluted eyesore for several years after a would - be developer stripped the property of valuable metals knocked down some buildings and left behind piles of asbestos - tainted debris beech nut new york public library county economic development canajoharie niagara municipal complex mayor francis avery montgomery county spaulding fibre beech matthew l ossenfort
